message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with the task of 2D hand pose estimation from a monocular RGB image. Additionally, the paper proposes a new architecture that uses deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) for calculating unary and pairwise potential functions, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. 

The paper also involves the use of graphical models, which are commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The use of DCNNs and graphical models for hand pose estimation can also be related to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category, as it can be used for robotic hand manipulation. 

Finally, the paper involves experiments on public datasets, which can be related to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category, as it deals with the analysis and processing of multimedia data. The use of DCNNs for hand pose estimation can also be related to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category, as it involves the training and optimization of deep neural networks.
